definitions: A buffer solution commonly used in biological research. It is a salt solution containing sodium chloride, sodium phosphate, and, in some formulations, potassium chloride and potassium phosphate. The buffer helps to maintain a constant pH, mimicking the in vivo environment.
examples: Cells were washed with phosphate buffered saline.
Prepare a 1X solution of phosphate buffered saline.
The reagent was diluted in phosphate buffered saline.
